documentationPage.title: Repairing Hub Documentation
documentationPage.subtitle: Learn how to use Repairing Hub effectively
documentationPage.gettingStartedDescription: Learn the basics of using our platform
documentationPage.whatIsRepairingHubDescription: Repairing Hub is a two-sided marketplace that connects customers seeking small jobs (assembly, repairs, household help) with skilled service providers. Our platform makes it easy to find reliable help for your home maintenance needs or to offer your services to those who need them.
documentationPage.creatingAccountDescription: To get started with Repairing Hub, you'll need to create an account. Follow these steps:
documentationPage.creatingAccountStep1: Click the 'Register' button in the top right corner of the homepage.
documentationPage.creatingAccountStep2: Fill in your personal details, including your name, email, and password.
documentationPage.creatingAccountStep3: Choose your account type: Customer or Service Provider.
documentationPage.creatingAccountStep4: Verify your email address using the code sent to your inbox, then log in to your new account.
documentationPage.navigatingPlatformDescription: Once you've created an account, you can navigate the platform using the main menu:
documentationPage.home: The main landing page with featured jobs and services.
documentationPage.jobs: Browse all available jobs or post your own if you're a customer.
documentationPage.profile: Manage your account, view your jobs or services, and track earnings.
documentationPage.notifications: Stay updated on new quotes, messages, and job status changes.
documentationPage.homeDescription: The main landing page with featured jobs and services.
documentationPage.jobsDescription: Browse all available jobs or post your own if you're a customer.
documentationPage.profileDescription: Manage your account, view your jobs or services, and track earnings.
documentationPage.notificationsDescription: Stay updated on new quotes, messages, and job status changes.
documentationPage.contactSupport: If you have any questions or need assistance, please visit our
documentationPage.toGetInTouch: to get in touch with our support team.
documentationPage.forCustomersDescription: Learn how to post jobs and hire service providers
documentationPage.postingJobDescription: To post a job on Repairing Hub, follow these steps:
documentationPage.jobTitle: Job title: A clear, concise title describing the job
documentationPage.jobDescription: Job description: Detailed information about what needs to be done
documentationPage.budget: Budget: How much you're willing to pay for the service
documentationPage.location: Location: Where the job needs to be performed
documentationPage.dateNeeded: Date needed: When you need the job to be completed
documentationPage.reviewingQuotesDescription: After posting a job, service providers will send you quotes. Here's how to review them:
reviewQuotesSteps: Go to your job listing or check your notifications for new quotes.
Review each provider's quote, including their price, message, and any attached images.
Click 'Message' to ask questions or discuss details with the provider.
Compare quotes based on price, provider experience, and communication.
documentationPage.hiringServiceProviderDescription: When you're ready to hire a service provider:
hiringSteps: Click the 'Hire' button on the provider's quote.
Confirm your decision in the popup dialog.
The funds you paid when posting the job will be held in escrow.
The provider will be notified that they've been hired.
You can communicate with the provider through the messaging system to coordinate details.
documentationPage.completingJobDescription: After the service provider has completed the job:
completingSteps: Inspect the work to ensure it meets your requirements.
If satisfied, click the 'Mark as Completed' button on the job page.
The funds held in escrow will be released to the service provider.
You'll be prompted to leave a review and rating for the provider.
The job will be marked as completed in your job history.
documentationPage.importantNoteDescription: Only mark a job as completed after you've thoroughly inspected the work. Once you mark a job as completed, the funds will be released to the provider and cannot be refunded.
documentationPage.forServiceProviders: For Service Providers: Finding Jobs & Getting Paid
documentationPage.forServiceProvidersDescription: Learn how to find jobs, submit quotes, and receive payments
documentationPage.findingJobsDescription: As a service provider, you can find jobs in several ways:
documentationPage.browseJobs: Browse Jobs: Go to the 'Jobs' page to see all available jobs.
documentationPage.useFilters: Use Filters: Filter jobs by location, category, and price range to find relevant opportunities.
documentationPage.search: Search: Use the search bar to find specific types of jobs.
documentationPage.enableNotifications: Notifications: Enable notifications to be alerted when new jobs matching your skills are posted.
documentationPage.submittingQuotesDescription: When you find a job you're interested in, you can submit a quote:
submittingQuotesSteps: Click on the job to view its details.
Review the job description, budget, location, and timeline.
Scroll down to the 'Send a Quote' section.
Write a detailed message explaining your experience and qualifications relevant to the job, how you plan to approach the job, your estimated timeline, and any questions you have for the customer.
Enter your price for the job.
Optionally, attach an image (e.g., previous similar work).
Click 'Submit Quote' to send your proposal to the customer.
gettingHiredSteps: Message you: Respond promptly and professionally to build trust.
Request more information: Be prepared to provide additional details about your experience or approach.
Hire you: You'll receive a notification when you're hired for a job.
documentationPage.gettingHiredAdditionalInfo: When hired, coordinate with the customer to schedule the job and discuss any specific requirements.
documentationPage.gettingPaidDescription: When you complete a job, payment is processed through our secure system:
gettingPaidSteps: After you finish the job, ask the customer to mark it as completed.
Once the customer confirms completion, the funds held in escrow will be released to your account.
The platform fee (10%) will be deducted automatically.
You can view your earnings in the 'Earnings' tab of your profile.
Withdraw your available funds to your PayPal account at any time.
documentationPage.proTipDescription: Maintain a high rating by providing quality service, communicating clearly, and completing jobs on time. Highly-rated providers are more likely to get hired for future jobs.
documentationPage.paymentsAndSecurityDescription: Learn about our secure payment system and escrow service
documentationPage.howPaymentsWorkDescription: Repairing Hub uses a secure escrow payment system to protect both customers and service providers:
documentationPage.jobPosting: Job Posting: When a customer posts a job, they pay the job budget plus a 10% service fee.
documentationPage.escrow: Escrow: The funds are held securely in escrow until the job is completed.
documentationPage.hiring: Hiring: When a provider is hired, the funds remain in escrow.
documentationPage.completion: Completion: After the job is completed and the customer confirms satisfaction, the funds are released to the provider.
documentationPage.platformFee: Platform Fee: A 10% fee is deducted from the provider's payment as a platform service fee.
documentationPage.paymentMethodsDescription: Repairing Hub supports the following payment methods:
documentationPage.creditDebitCards: Credit/Debit Cards: All major credit and debit cards are accepted.
documentationPage.payPal: PayPal: Secure payments through your PayPal account.
documentationPage.withdrawalsInfo: For withdrawals, service providers can transfer their earnings to their PayPal account.
documentationPage.securityMeasuresDescription: We take security seriously and have implemented several measures to protect our users:
documentationPage.securePayments: Secure Payments: All payment information is encrypted and processed securely.
documentationPage.escrowSystem: Escrow System: Funds are held securely until job completion, protecting both parties.
documentationPage.userVerification: User Verification: We verify user identities to ensure platform safety.
documentationPage.ratingsReviews: Ratings & Reviews: Our review system helps identify reliable users.
documentationPage.secureMessaging: Secure Messaging: All communications between users are encrypted.
documentationPage.disputeResolutionDescription: In case of disagreements between customers and service providers:
disputeResolutionSteps: First, try to resolve the issue through direct communication.
If that doesn't work, either party can open a dispute through the platform.
Our support team will review the case, including all messages and job details.
We may request additional information or evidence from both parties.
After review, we'll make a fair decision about the release of funds.
documentationPage.importantSecurityNoticeDescription: Never share your payment information or conduct transactions outside of the Repairing Hub platform. Doing so will void our protection guarantees and may result in account suspension.
